intro: Bridelia sosopodonica, commonly known as the African bridlewood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
